channel.title: CLASSPATH/Path issue
channel.description:
Yeah, well I sort've fucked up my CLASSPATH and Path Varibles while trying to be able to make it where I can complie, I can complie and everything now, just I can't use the CMD Promp. . . Someone help?
Like how do I set the top CLASSPATH and Path and the bottom ones?

item.title: CLASSPATH/Path issue
item.dc:creator: @Mr.czar Mr.czar
item.description:
@Mr.czar wrote:

If you have any other questions dealing with this topic feel free to PM me on here.

Read full topic

item.title: CLASSPATH/Path issue
item.dc:creator: @demonlover14 demonlover14
item.description:
@demonlover14 wrote:

[quote=“Mr.czar, post:5, topic:408867”]In system variables just add one called path and put this in it: “C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32\Wbem” without the quotes.

If that doesn’t work may I ask your operating system? the above is for XP.

WIN 7

“C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32\Wbem;C:\WINDOWS\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0;”[/quote]

Thanks, I can Complie and use Ipconfig and commond promp commands and such.

Read full topic

item.title: CLASSPATH/Path issue

In system variables just add one called path and put this in it: “C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32\Wbem” without the quotes.

If that doesn’t work may I ask your operating system? the above is for XP.

WIN 7

“C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32\Wbem;C:\WINDOWS\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0;”

item.title: CLASSPATH/Path issue

@demonlover14 wrote:

I need to re do…

Read full topic

item.title: CLASSPATH/Path issue
item.dc:creator: @Mr.czar Mr.czar
item.description:
@Mr.czar wrote:

Close any CMD windows
Click the Start Button
Right-click “Computer”, select “Properties”
In the left pane, click “Advanced system Settings”
In the “Advanced” tabe, click “Environment Variables”
In the “System variables” list, find and select “Path”, then click “Edit”
Add “%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;” (without quotes) to the beginning of the variable value. Be careful not to delete anything;

Read full topic
